definition: lapel/overlap of Chinese gown/fig. bosom (the seat of emotions)/to cherish (ambition, desires, honorable intentions etc) in one's bosom
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌

sentences.english: You use the emergency brake to drop the flaps.
sentences.chinese: 當你使用緊急剎車來放襟翼。

sentences.english: You will notice that with your flaps down, your nose has a tendency to rise.
sentences.chinese: 你會發現，隨着襟翼的放下，你的機頭會向上翹起。

sentences.english: We are trying to dump our fuel with gear down and full flaps.
sentences.chinese: 我們試圖將起落架放下和全襟翼進行放油。

sentences.english: A section of( wing trailing-edge) flap detached during flight probably due to material fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 一段襟翼在飛行中掉落可能因材料疲乏。

sentences.english: A seagull hit the right wing tip leading edge flap sustained minor damage.
sentences.chinese: 右翼尖與一隻海鷗相撞，前緣襟翼受到輕微損傷。

sentences.english: Now the flaps were fully retracted.
sentences.chinese: 現在襟翼全部收縮進去了。

definition: the rear (tail) of a plane etc
the front (nose) of a plane etc
empennage (of an aircraft)/fletching (of an arrow)/fins (of a missile, rocket etc)/rear spoiler (of a car)
